column2: we got half a dozen east coast oysters
column5: and rib eye. Oysters were fresh
column6: but I guess you can't really mess up oysters. The bone marrow was very very yummy--but again
column7: you can't really mess up fat. What I think really stood out were the fried chicken and rib eye. I am a fried chicken snob
column8: the meat needs to be tender and juicy
column9: and outside needs to be crunchy
column10: but not too bready. I personally think this was one of the best fried chickens I've had
column12: and they gave you a LOT. I took home half of the fried chicken and it's my lunch the next day. My husband's rib eye was perfectly medium rare
